name: Grilled Pork Belly BLT with Fried Tomatoes and Avocado
author: Avocados from Mexico
summary: Imagine a dish that combines melt-in-your-mouth grilled goodness with creamy avocado. Now make it for real!! This sandwich uses a succulent rich meat (pork belly) seasoned with typical Japanese condiments. It's said that bacon is its very own food group, and pork belly is part of that food group!
ingredients: Salt and ground white pepper to taste
1 pound skinless pork belly, thinly sliced
2  ripe avocados from Mexico, peeled, pitted and sliced
directions: Combine soy sauce, mirin, salt and white pepper in a bowl
Add pork slices and mix to coat with marinade
Cover and refrigerate 30 minutes or overnight
Heat a grill pan and brush or spray with vegetable oil
Place pork slices on grill and cook until well seared, turning every 3 to 4 minutes
Mix flour, salt, pepper and seasoned salt together in a shallow dish for dredging
Beat eggs in a third bowl
Dip tomato slices into milk, then flour mixture, then eggs
Coat well with flour mixture again
Heat butter and olive oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat
Place tomato slices in pan and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side
If necessary, place in warm oven until ready to serve
To build sandwiches, spread mayonnaise on bread slices
On half the slices, layer lettuce, avocado slices, grilled pork belly and fried tomatoes
